newsitem.title: INDIA: First Ford car rolls out from India assembly line.
newsitem.headline: First Ford car rolls out from India assembly line.

text.p: The first car produced by Ford Motor Company in India rolled out of the assembly line on Monday, 10 months after government cleared the venture, the company said in a statement.
The Ford Escort is produced by a joint venture between Ford and India's Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M).

"The speed with which this program has come together is indicative of the cooperation between the joint venture partners and the Maharashtra government," said Alex Trotman, chairman of Ford Motor Company, according to the statement.
M&M and Ford each hold 50 percent in the Mahindra Ford joint venture at Nashik, 225 km (140 miles) north east of Bombay in the western Indian state of Maharashtra.
Ford Escort will be available in four models -- 1.3 petrol LX and 1.8 diesel LX and their standard series. Booking is expected to open next month.
M&M is India's largest maker of utility vehicles and tractors. It has market share of 57 percent in utility vehicles and 28 percent in tractors.
Ford is the world's second largest car and trucker producer and is ranked second on the Fortune 500 list of the largest U.S. industrial corporations based on sales.
